title: What it's really like to live and ski like an oligarch in Courchevel
text:
Many of the world’s greatest ski resorts are preceded by their reputation. America’s Jackson Hole – steep and deep, Austria’s St Anton – wild après, and Switzerland’s Zermatt – picture perfect with its Matterhorn backdrop. For Courchevel – and especially the highest of its six villages, Courchevel 1850 – it’s all about luxury.

And we’re talking diamond-encrusted, your-wish-is-our-command, A-list luxury here, the go-to destination for high-profile celebrities and undercover oligarchs alike. The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge famously spent their first ski holiday as a family here; the Beckhams are regulars too.

So, when presented with the opportunity to spend two nights at one of 1850’s most exclusive...
description: Many of the world’s greatest ski resorts are preceded by their reputation.
